intro: Justicia striata subsp. striata, commonly known as the narrowleaf false arum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spatulate-shaped leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white with a red or purple calyx. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and greenhouses.
